dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 814 IH: Defund the CFPB Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Self (for himself, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Grothman, Mr. Tiffany, and Mr. Pfluger) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to limit to $0 the amount that the Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection may request to fund the activities of the Bureau.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defund the CFPB Act.

section.header: Limiting funding of bureau of consumer financial protection
section.text: Section 1017(a) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5497(a)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking taking into account and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting which shall be not more than $0.;
by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (2) and (3), respectively.
